title: George Tyson (1900s rugby league)
text:
George Frederick Tyson ( – 21 May 1937) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage No. 79</a>), as a , i.e. number 2 or 5.
Playing career.
International honours.
Tyson won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Oldham in 1908 against Wales, in 1909 against Australia (2 matches), and Wales, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Oldham in 1908 against New Zealand, and in 1908-09 against Australia (3 matches).
Championship appearances.
George Tyson played in <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>'s victory in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> during the <a href="1904%E2%80%9305%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1904–05 season</a>.
George Tyson played , i.e. number 2, in <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>'s 3-7 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1908%E2%80%9309%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1908–09 season</a> at <a href="The%20Willows%2C%20Salford">the Willows</a>, <a href="County%20Borough%20of%20Salford">Salford</a> on Saturday 1 May 1909.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
George Tyson played , i.e. number 5, in Oldham's 3-17 defeat by <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1907%20Challenge%20Cup">1907</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1906%E2%80%9307%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1906–07 season</a> at <a href="Wheater%27s%20Field">Wheater's Field</a>, <a href="Broughton%2C%20Salford">Broughton, Salford</a> on Saturday 27 April 1907, in front of a crowd of 18,500.
County Cup Final appearances.
George Tyson played , i.e. number 2, in <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>'s 9-10 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1908%20Lancashire%20Cup">1908</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1908%E2%80%9309%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1908–09 season</a> at <a href="Wheater%27s%20Field">Wheater's Field</a>, <a href="Broughton%2C%20Salford">Broughton</a>, <a href="County%20Borough%20of%20Salford">Salford</a> on Saturday 19 December 1908.
Club career.
George Tyson was considered a "Probable" for the <a href="1910%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1910 Great Britain Lions tour of Australia and New Zealand</a>, but decided not to take part in the tour due to "business reasons".
